column4: Is there anyway that I can add a resolution to ubuntu?  its not the best for this monitor
have you got the graphics card driver installed?
I believe I do
no you won't have unless you installed it yourself
system >  administaration >  hardware drivers
thanks... I don't even know what this thing has.
get that thing installed and then you will probably have more resoloution options
oh old HP hummmmm
ok tell me if anything is in hardware drivers
which version of Ubuntu, and how old is the HP?
- Ubuntu 8.04, its an HP Pavilion a620n
ok it is hardy good, but  a server hummmm. well you don't need much of a resoloution on a server, if your using it as a server LOL
I mean proper servers just do their thing and that's it, not used for anything else
you're right.  Normally I dont isntall anything on server... no GUI at all... but this time i did in hopes of eventually installing backend mythtv
ok I guess since it's an old computer, that could be why you hardly got any resolutions
like none of the aspects are right for a widescreen monitor
but its okay, I will just let this sit after time... I put 2 1.5 TB drives in it :)
I am ready to move on...  I do have another question you might be able to guide me in the right direction... iSCSI.  I want to share to a windows server.
hummmmmm not sure, but Samba does Windows files
that would be easy.  I wanted to control permissions with the windows box.  I beleive iscsi is the only way.  Only because I have a domain controller
maybe they can help in #Windows :D  plus  some  Linux people go there
if i could do it with SMB I would.
ok sure
oh yeah and this is more general  Linux channel #linux
